intro: Oenothera hispida, commonly known as the hispid evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal and ornamental value. Its seeds contain oils that have been used in traditional medicine and skincare products. Oenothera hispida thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
